ephysiopy.format_converters package¶

Submodules¶

ephysiopy.format_converters.OE_Axona module¶

openephys to Axona file format conversion

class ephysiopy.format_converters.OE_Axona.OE2Axona(filename_root: str)¶

Bases: object

Converts openephys data recorded in the nwb format into Axona files

convertPosData(xy: numpy.array, xy_ts: numpy.array) → numpy.array¶

Perform the conversion of the array parts of the data NB As well as upsampling the data to the Axona pos sampling rate (50Hz) we have to insert some columns into the pos array as Axona format expects it like: pos_format: t,x1,y1,x2,y2,numpix1,numpix2 We can make up some of the info and ignore other bits

convertSpikeData(hdf5_tetrode_data: h5py._hl.group.Group)¶

Does the spike conversion from OE Spike Sorter format to Axona format tetrode files

Parameters

- h5py._hl.group.Group - this kind of looks like a dictionary and can, it seems, (hdf5_tetrode_data) – be treated as one more or less (see http://docs.h5py.org/en/stable/high/group.html).

exportLFP(channel: int, lfp_type: str, gain: int)¶

Export LFP data to file

Parameters

  • - int (channel) –

  • - str. Legal values are 'egf' or 'eeg' (lfp_type) –

  • - int. Multiplier for the lfp data (gain) –

exportPos(ppm=300, jumpmax=100, as_text=False)¶
exportSetFile(**kwargs)¶

Wrapper for makeSetData below

exportSpikes()¶
getOEData(filename_root: str, recording_name='recording1') → dict¶

Loads the nwb file names in filename_root and returns a dict containing some of the nwb data relevant for converting to Axona file formats

Parameters

  • - fuly qualified name of the nwb file (filename_root) –

  • - the name of the recording in the nwb file NB the default has changed in different versions of OE from 'recording0' to 'recording1' (recording_name) –

makeLFPData(hdf5_continuous_data: numpy.array, eeg_type='eeg', gain=5000)¶

Downsamples the data in hdf5_continuous_data and saves the result as either an egf or eeg file depending on the choice of either eeg_type which can take a value of either ‘egf’ or ‘eeg’ gain is the scaling factor

Parameters

- np.array with dtype as np.int16 (hdf5_continuous_data) –

makeSetData(lfp_channel=1, **kwargs)¶
resample(data, src_rate=30, dst_rate=50, axis=0)¶

Upsamples data using FFT

property settings¶

Loads the settings data from the settings.xml file

writePos2AxonaFormat(header: dict, data: numpy.array)¶
writeSetData(header: dict)¶
writeTetrodeData(tetnum: str, header: dict, data: numpy.array)¶

ephysiopy.format_converters.OE_numpy module¶

openephys to numpy file conversion

class ephysiopy.format_converters.OE_numpy.OE2Numpy(filename_root: str)¶

Bases: object

Converts openephys data recorded in the nwb format into numpy files

NB Only exports the LFP and TTL files at the moment
